title: Typophile back online
content:
Yes, it’s so fast! Really nice.

 [‹ Typographic Budapest?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704152428/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34924 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font help needed (new serifs) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704152428/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34618 "Go to next forum topic")
author: T.

comments.content:
and yes, we appeciate it.

We missed you - glad you are back - stronger and healthier than ever.

Happy Independence Day....

When will the membership signup be ready for contributions?

ChrisL
Hadn’t realized how slow it was until seeing how fast it is...

So much better - thanks!

(I still miss the IMs)

and added that line to see what it did to my post time, it slipped. So the moratorium on post editing still holds.
Everything is great! Thank you so much.
Thanks again Punchcut!
It’s really great with this speed boost! Now I like this place even more... Thanks!

I like fast. Thanks.

hhp
Typophile, how I missed thee. Fill again the void in my heart!
Wow, those were some powerful withdrawal symptoms! :-)

_some powerful withdrawal symptoms!_

Uh... must... have... **TYPOPHILE!... argh-guh-ugh-hhh...**  
(Starts foaming at the mouth.) ;-D

Nice to have you walking tall again, Typophile. Thanks to you, good folks at Punchcut, for this upgrade — whenever you are ready to take donations or membership fees again, I’ll be ready.

Nice works guys, thanks to all!!

Can I buy a Typophile t-shirt?

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Hiro
SO much better. Thanks!
Great job. I know you wish we’d say the same about software upgrade... ;)

Nice. When are memberships going to be working again? I need a new Typophile shirt.

Héctor
Much better. I think it’s time to make a contribution…
Will those of us who contributed while the site was down get memberships too when that’s working again? I ponied up.
I’ve been on vacation and was just checking in. What a nice surprise! Congrats to all involved in the upgrade.

\> Chris:

So happy to see you back again!

————————-  
Typophile is ready for the next generation. So fast. Bravo! and Thanks for those who work on that upgrade.

_Will those of us who contributed while the site was down get memberships too when that’s working again? I ponied up._

That’s not a bad idea...

I don’t think this donation should count towards a future membership fee.

hhp
Actually I just saw the very nice thank-you, so I retract my previous statement.

Wonderful, wonderful! Thanks for all the hard work. I love this place. :-)

Sharon
Yeah, I’ll say it again, thanks Punchcut. I agree, membership options with new tees! Perhaps a tee design contest on typophile?

<cite>I don’t think this donation should count towards a future membership fee.</cite>

Why not? I’ve wanted to join for awhile and it hasn’t been possible. Isn’t the point of membership to support the hard work of the typophile team? What’s the diff?

It seems to me that the spirit of the donation should not be encumbered by expecting something in return. I think most of us did it simply to show appreciation for this event. But there’s no reason different views can’t be accomodated... via the making of future donations by the willing. :-)

hhp
And exactly how are such donations made now? The experience is much better than ever - thank you all so much.

Glad to see you back, Typophile! Thanks Punchcut!

s’marks

_It seems to me that the spirit of the donation should not be encumbered by expecting something in return._

That’s how I felt immediately after posting my first message.

_via the making of future donations by the willing_

Yeah, bring on memberships! I’m ready to sign up the entire studio, whether they like it or not ;P

Thank you! I have missed it.

Ahmad Shawkash

I like the idea of the membership thing remaining voluntary. I first found the site several years ago, and didn’t join right away because I thought it was paid only (and at that time money and food were a bit more closely connected in my life).

Now that I can, I will pay my share, but I like the idea that there is no distinction between those who have, and those who cannot (or will not, I suppose). Or if there is a distinction, let it be on the profile page or somewhere, and not on the forums.

Actually, there _was_ a distinction back when membership was offered: access to certain parts of the site. On the other hand those parts remained tellingly deserted (even though there were a good number of -otherwise active- members).

hhp

That speedbust was really necessary... ; ) Nice.

BTW Where are the previous and next links?

(And a reminder: I paid for a membership & never got my T-shirt. So…)

\_\_\_  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Hooray! It’s back!

One little thing, though: The favicon is missing from the “shortcut icon” in the HTML.
Anyone having trouble with the RSS not showing most of what gets posted?

(seems to be fixed now)

thanks

Look at the bottom of every page ;)

Christian,  
You mean right there at the bottom after the copyright the blue word “feedback”?

:-)

ChrisL

As my Grandma used to say, “If it was a snake it would have bit me!”  
; )

\> _Anyone having trouble with the RSS not showing most of what gets posted?_

I believe the RSS of thread posts was purposely delayed when the forum was just back online the first time. I’m not sure if it still is after it came back online the second time, with the new hosting package, though.

It looks like it, sometimes a lot of new posts show up in my reader, other times only sporadically, eventhough there are new threads.
